awd_titl_txt: Single Crystal Silicon Carbide on Silicon Substrates
awd_abstract_narration: Silicon carbide has long received interest as a candidate  for                  high temperature, radiation  tolerant semiconductor devices.                    Transistors and optoelectronic components have been successfully                fabricated, demonstrating the potential of the material.  A                     barrier to the widespread use of this promising material has been               the problem of fabricating good quality single crystal films.                   Previous research using chemical vapor deposition methods have                  not been successful in eliminating major defects on inexpensive                 silicon substrates.  A new method of fabrication is described                   which is based on the technique of ion beam sythesis.  Novel                    treatments are proposed in order to provide single crystal,                     epitaxial growth on a silicon substrate.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships
